column4: just wondering if anyone could help me with the install of 9.04 on an Benq S42 laptop please?
what's the problem?
the keyboard and pad doesn't get recognized
i have connected an ext usb mouse to it now...
uh oh.. well.. try to run the updates but damnit you'll need to input your password >_<
was the comment towards me mate?
Yeah nigel.
Maybe the update will get you some support, then after the update to to hardware drivers.
ok this is supposed to be a fix for it...
It's not but it might provide more support for it nigel.
This reply is from my S42 under linux using native keyboard. Kernel options required are:
i8042.nomux=1 i8042.noloop=1
Also the "|" isn't correctly mapped, you need to create a file ~/.xmodmap. In it, you need the following entry:
keycode 94 = backslash bar
how can i acheive this.. i'm pretty much a newbie
ok Nigel, i think you're going to need a diffrent means of typing..
ext usb keyboard??
That will be fine
you're in luck mate
http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=5290024&postcount=1
did you get that??
thanks mate.. I'll give that a go bud
